unnormalised: New Delhi: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has approved the merger of HDFC Ltd. with HDFC Bank, effective July 1, 2023. The order, pronounced on June 30th, 2023, marks a significant consolidation in the Indian financial sector. The merger, initially announced on April 4, 2022, aims to create a larger, stronger financial institution capable of competing globally.
normalised: New Delhi: The N-C-L-T has approved the merger of H-D-F-C Limited with H-D-F-C Bank, effective first July two thousand and twenty three. The order, pronounced on thirtieth June, two thousand and twenty three, marks a significant consolidation in the Indian financial sector. The merger, initially announced on fourth April, two thousand and twenty two, aims to create a larger, stronger financial institution capable of competing globally.

unnormalised: Adv. Rohan Sharma, representing HDFC, stated that the merged entity is expected to have a combined asset base of approx. Rs. 18 lakh crore. Key regulatory approvals were obtained from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and the Competition Commission of India (CCI) under Section 31 of the Competition Act, 2002. This move is projected to enhance operational efficiency and provide a broader range of financial services to customers.
normalised: Advocate Rohan Sharma, representing H-D-F-C, stated that the merged entity is expected to have a combined asset base of approximately rupees eighteen lakh crore. Key regulatory approvals were obtained from the R-B-I and the Competition Commission of India (C-C-I) under Section thirty one of the Competition Act, two thousand and two. This move is projected to enhance operational efficiency and provide a broader range of financial services to customers.

unnormalised: The NCLT's approval under Sections 230-232 of the Companies Act, 2013, paves the way for the final integration. Market analysts anticipate a positive impact on the stock prices of both entities. The next hearing is scheduled for 15/08/2023 to review the progress on the implementation of the merger scheme.
normalised: The N-C-L-T's approval under Sections two hundred and thirty to two hundred and thirty two of the Companies Act, two thousand and thirteen, paves the way for the final integration. Market analysts anticipate a positive impact on the stock prices of both entities. The next hearing is scheduled for fifteenth August, two thousand and twenty three to review the progress on the implementation of the merger scheme.
